originalTitle: South Africa to deploy troops to tackle crime gangs
title: South Africa to deploy troops to tackle crime gangs
content: President Cyril Ramaphosa says the army will work with the police to fight organised crime and illegal mining.

originalTitle: A seat at the table or on the menu? Africa grapples with the new world order
title: A seat at the table or on the menu? Africa grapples with the new world order
content: The US president has shaken up international relations and the continent is working out where it stands.

originalTitle: Brilliant Muzarabani helps Zimbabwe stun Australia
title: Zimbabwe's Super Win! A Happy Day for Africa!
content:
Hello, my little champions! I'm your friendly news reporter for Africa! I have super exciting news for you today! Something amazing happened that made everyone cheer very loudly! It is a story about being brave, working together, and a big, happy surprise! Get ready to be amazed!

A Big Surprise for Everyone!

Imagine a big game called cricket! Two teams were playing. One team was from Australia. Many people think the Australian team is very, very strong. They often win games. The other team was our very own Zimbabwe! Zimbabwe is a beautiful country in Southern Africa. Guess what happened? Our team, Zimbabwe, won against Australia! Yes, you heard me right! It was a super surprise and a very happy moment for all of us in Africa!

What is Cricket? (It's Fun!)

Did you know what cricket is? It's a fun game played with a bat and a ball. Players try to hit the ball very far. When they hit it well and run, they score "runs." "Runs" are like points in other games! The team that scores the most runs wins the game. It's very exciting to watch! There are also "wickets." When a player who throws the ball (we call him a bowler) gets a player from the other team out, it's called taking a wicket. It's a bit like getting a player "out" in a game of tag.

Meet Our Hero: Blessing Muzarabani!

Now, let me tell you about a super-duper star! His name is Blessing Muzarabani. What a wonderful name, right? Blessing is a very tall and strong player from Zimbabwe. He is a bowler, so he throws the ball really fast! In this big game, Blessing Muzarabani was like a superhero! He threw the ball so, so well. He got four players from Australia "out"! This is called taking four "wickets." Taking four wickets is a fantastic job for a bowler! It made it very hard for the Australian team to score runs. Blessing was truly amazing and made us all very proud! He only let the other team score a few runs while he was bowling. This was super important for our team to win.

Our Brave Zimbabwe Team Played Their Best!

Our Zimbabwe team played with all their hearts! They did not give up, even though Australia is a very tough team to play against. Our team played so bravely! They hit the ball well when it was their turn. They also caught the ball well when Australia was hitting it. Every single player in the team tried their very best. This is what teamwork is all about! Everyone working together like a family to reach one big goal. They helped each other.

How Did Zimbabwe Win?

First, our Zimbabwe team batted and scored some runs. Then it was Australia's turn to bat and try to score more runs than Zimbabwe. But Australia could not score as many runs as Zimbabwe. Why? Because of the super bowling from Blessing and great play from everyone else! Australia was behind in runs. In the end, Zimbabwe won by 23 runs! This means our team scored 23 more runs than Australia. That's a good, clear win! It made everyone jump and shout with joy!

Did You Know? Fun Facts!

* Did you know? Cricket is played in many, many countries around the world, not just in Africa! It is a very popular sport. * Did you know? The game they played was part of the "T20 World Cup." A World Cup is a very big and important competition where the best teams from all over the world play! * Did you know? T20 means the game is a bit shorter and very exciting, like a fast-paced story with lots of action! * Did you know? Zimbabwe is famous for its beautiful Victoria Falls, one of the biggest waterfalls in the world! * Did you know? Playing sports teaches us to be strong, to work together, and to never give up on our dreams!

A Happy Day for All of Africa!

When Zimbabwe won this big game, it was a happy day for everyone in Africa. It shows that even if some people think another team is stronger, with hard work and believing in yourself, you can achieve amazing things! It shows that our teams from Africa can play very, very well on the world stage. This win makes all of us feel so proud of our continent and our people!

Never Give Up!

This wonderful story of Zimbabwe winning against Australia teaches us a very important lesson: Never, ever give up on your dreams! Work hard every day, practice what you love, and always believe in yourself. Just like Blessing Muzarabani and the whole brave Zimbabwe team showed us, anything is possible if you try your best! Let's cheer for our African heroes! They made us all smile and feel proud. Hip hip hooray for Zimbabwe! Keep watching out for more exciting news, my little friends! Stay happy and keep playing!
summary: Zimbabwe's cricket team, with amazing bowling from Blessing Muzarabani, won a big game against Australia, making everyone in Africa very happy and proud.
whyMatters: This win is very important because it shows that our teams from Africa can be super strong and win against the best teams in the world! It makes us all proud and teaches us to never give up on our dreams, just like our heroes in Zimbabwe!

originalTitle: What does BNP’s landslide mean for Bangladesh’s post-uprising order?
title: What does BNP’s landslide mean for Bangladesh’s post-uprising order?
content: The victorious BNP was sceptical of constitutional reforms outlined in July Charter - now it must implement them.

originalTitle: Man City's Rodri charged over 'not fair' referee comments
title: Man City's Rodri charged over 'not fair' referee comments
content: Manchester City midfielder Rodri is charged with misconduct by the Football Association following comments he made about referees following his side's 2-2 draw with Tottenham earlier this month.

originalTitle: O'Neill to juggle Blackburn & Northern Ireland roles
title: O'Neill to juggle Blackburn & Northern Ireland roles
content: Northern Ireland manager Michael O'Neill is appointed Blackburn Rovers boss until the end of the season in a move that will see him juggle both roles.
